results.title: Haemostatic effects of simvastatin in subjects with impaired glucose tolerance.
results.text_hl: Haemostatic effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in subjects with @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin effects on skeletal muscle: relation to decreased mitochondrial function and glucose intolerance.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ effects on skeletal muscle: relation to decreased mitochondrial function and @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@glucose intolerance@@@.

citations.NLM: Larsen S, Stride N, Hey-Mogensen M, Hansen CN, Bang LE, Bundgaard H, Nielsen LB, Helge JW, Dela F. Simvastatin effects on skeletal muscle: relation to decreased mitochondrial function and glucose intolerance. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2013 Jan 8;61(1):44-53. PMID: 23287371

results.title: Simvastatin-Induced Insulin Resistance May Be Linked to Decreased Lipid Uptake and Lipid Synthesis in Human Skeletal Muscle: the LIFESTAT Study
results.text_hl: A prevalent side-effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@glucose@@@ homeostasis.

citations.NLM: Larsen S, Vigelsø A, Dandanell S, Prats C, Dela F, Helge JW. Simvastatin-Induced Insulin Resistance May Be Linked to Decreased Lipid Uptake and Lipid Synthesis in Human Skeletal Muscle: the LIFESTAT Study J Diabetes Res. 2018;2018():9257874. PMID: 30276217

results.title: Simvastatin Inhibits L-Type Ca2+-Channel Activity Through Impairment of Mitochondrial Function.
results.text_hl: In this study, we investigated whether the @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@glucose intolerance@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is also mediated via adverse effects on mETC in pancreatic beta-cells because mitochondrial respiration underlies insulin secretion from these cells, an effect in part mediated by promotion of Ca2+ influx via opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs).

citations.NLM: Curry L, Almukhtar H, Alahmed J, Roberts R, Smith PA. Simvastatin Inhibits L-Type Ca2+-Channel Activity Through Impairment of Mitochondrial Function. Toxicol Sci. 2019 Jun 1;169(2):543-552. PMID: 30859212
citations.BibTeX: @article{30859212, title={Simvastatin Inhibits L-Type Ca2+-Channel Activity Through Impairment of Mitochondrial Function.}, author={Curry L and Almukhtar H and Alahmed J and Roberts R and Smith PA}, journal={Toxicol Sci}, volume={169}, number={2}, pages={543-552}}

results.title: Statins exacerbate glucose intolerance and hyperglycemia in a high sucrose fed rodent model
results.text_hl: We utilized two statins: @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, the most prescribed statins to delineate potential role in @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@glucose intolerance@@@.

citations.NLM: Seshadri S, Rapaka N, Prajapati B, Mandaliya D, Patel S, Muggalla CS, Kapadia B, Babu PP, Misra P, Saxena U. Statins exacerbate glucose intolerance and hyperglycemia in a high sucrose fed rodent model Sci Rep. 2019 Jun 19;9(1):8825. PMID: 31217552
citations.BibTeX: @article{31217552, title={Statins exacerbate glucose intolerance and hyperglycemia in a high sucrose fed rodent model}, author={Seshadri S and Rapaka N and Prajapati B and Mandaliya D and Patel S and Muggalla CS and Kapadia B and Babu PP and Misra P and Saxena U}, journal={Sci Rep}, volume={9}, number={1}, pages={8825}}

results.title: The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances.
results.text_hl: The study included 47 @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerotic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the concomitant presence of @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@ already receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment (40 mg daily) who were allocated to one of two groups treated for 90 days with, respectively, @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ (200 mg daily) or placebo.

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Gdula-Dymek A, Okopien B. The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances. Basic Clin Pharmacol Toxicol. 2013 Mar;112(3):198-202. PMID: 22935083
citations.BibTeX: @article{22935083, title={The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances.}, author={Krysiak R and Gdula-Dymek A and Okopien B}, journal={Basic Clin Pharmacol Toxicol}, volume={112}, number={3}, pages={198-202}}

results.title: Selective inhibition of intestinal 5-HT improves neurobehavioral abnormalities caused by high-fat diet mice.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_LP533401 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C548240 @@@LP533401@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ could significantly improve the @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@, while BZ had no significant effect. (2) @CHEMICAL_LP533401 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C548240 @@@LP533401@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ and BZ alleviated @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@-like behavior of HFD @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ in OFT, TST, FST and SPT. (3) @CHEMICAL_LP533401 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C548240 @@@LP533401@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ reversed the inhibition of @GENE_TPH2 @GENE_216343 @@@Tryptophan Hydroxylase 2@@@, @GENE_TPH2 @GENE_216343 @@@Tph2@@@ gene expression and the activation of Indoleamine 2,3-dioxy-Genase, @GENE_IDO1 @GENE_15930 @@@IDO@@@ expression in HFD-treated brain, whereas BZ did not. (4) @CHEMICAL_LP533401 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C548240 @@@LP533401@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ and BZ restored the inhibitory expression of @GENE_HTR1A @GENE_15550 @@@5-HT1A receptor@@@ in HFD hippocampus.

citations.NLM: Pan Q, Liu Q, Wan R, Kalavagunta PK, Liu L, Lv W, Qiao T, Shang J, Wu H. Selective inhibition of intestinal 5-HT improves neurobehavioral abnormalities caused by high-fat diet mice. Metab Brain Dis. 2019 Jun;34(3):747-761. PMID: 30931486
citations.BibTeX: @article{30931486, title={Selective inhibition of intestinal 5-HT improves neurobehavioral abnormalities caused by high-fat diet mice.}, author={Pan Q and Liu Q and Wan R and Kalavagunta PK and Liu L and Lv W and Qiao T and Shang J and Wu H}, journal={Metab Brain Dis}, volume={34}, number={3}, pages={747-761}}

results.title: Are the beneficial cardiovascular effects of simvastatin and metformin also associated with a hormone-dependent mechanism improving insulin sensitivity?
results.text_hl: Forty-one subjects with BMI >25 kg/m(2) and @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@ were randomized to take @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, 20 mg/day (N = 20) or @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, 1.7 g/day (N = 21) for 16 weeks.

citations.NLM: Bulcão C, Giuffrida FM, Ribeiro-Filho FF, Ferreira SR. Are the beneficial cardiovascular effects of simvastatin and metformin also associated with a hormone-dependent mechanism improving insulin sensitivity? Braz J Med Biol Res. 2007 Feb;40(2):229-35. PMID: 17273659
citations.BibTeX: @article{17273659, title={Are the beneficial cardiovascular effects of simvastatin and metformin also associated with a hormone-dependent mechanism improving insulin sensitivity?}, author={Bulcão C and Giuffrida FM and Ribeiro-Filho FF and Ferreira SR}, journal={Braz J Med Biol Res}, volume={40}, number={2}, pages={229-35}}

results.title: Effects of simvastatin and metformin on inflammation and insulin resistance in individuals with mild metabolic syndrome.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Forty-one subjects with body mass index (BMI) 25-39.9 kg/m(2) and @<m>DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@ were randomized to receive @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ for 16 weeks.

citations.NLM: Bulcão C, Ribeiro-Filho FF, Sañudo A, Roberta Ferreira SG. Effects of simvastatin and metformin on inflammation and insulin resistance in individuals with mild metabolic syndrome. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2007;7(3):219-24. PMID: 17610348
citations.BibTeX: @article{17610348, title={Effects of simvastatin and metformin on inflammation and insulin resistance in individuals with mild metabolic syndrome.}, author={Bulcão C and Ribeiro-Filho FF and Sañudo A and Roberta Ferreira SG}, journal={Am J Cardiovasc Drugs}, volume={7}, number={3}, pages={219-24}}
